title: Wonder
description: I may have finally figured out personal commandment #1. To myself and everyone else: wonder without limits.

title: New site!
description: Yet another edition of pretty much the same website! Like most of the software I've been working on recently, the goal of this redesign is to *simplify* by moving much of the content itself off of the site and to really use this domain as a landing page for content elsewhere.

title: The Cave of Wonders
description: The start of a series where I lay out the most significant internet-age trends that'll have massive (potentially detrimental) social effects on American society. The necessary first steps are education and civic engagement.

title: sor launched!
description: Sor is an attempt to create a platform for practicing Javascript with the least amount of user overhead possible. My goal was to take advantage of existing tools (IDE's, unit testing frameworks, etc) to make the tool easy to use and maintain.

title: In Over Our Heads: The Great Depression
description: Another day, another knowledge-infused conversation about history. Here we go.

title: Elite Dangerous Paths
description: You know how when you go for a while without practicing your data structures you just feel an undying urge to put them to good use? The frontend for this project was my first foray into React and Redux, and the backend was designed to perform real-time routing among the millions and millions of discovered galaxy in the absolutely massive world of [Elite Dangeorus](https://www.elitedangerous.com/).

title: Dodona
description: "Bots", they say. "They're gonna be huge", they say. I'm still a tad skeptical, but I do like the idea of building one. This was a weekend project to create a [League of Legends](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/) bot that can automatically give you basic information on the team you're matched up against once the match begins. It is build using the Discord (Slack for gamers) API. It's still not ready for production but works really well for me!

title: In Over Our Heads: Deserts
description: Seems like a pretty dry topic until you really think about it, huh?

title: Harold
description: Like many of my projects, the key goal of Harold is to experiment in reduced complexity. Harold is an API server I designed for my class that makes it really easy to build endpoints for frontends. It's a perpetual work in progress but it continues to get simpler and easier to use over time.

title: In Over Our Heads: Agrarian Revolution
description: Food for thought, if nothing else.

title: Glimpse
description: I've been wanting to write Glimpse for a really long time. It's a virtual world generator + simulator that I'm hoping to make fun to watch. So far I've placed most of the emphasis on world *generation* (terrain, water tables, etc), but the latest commits have been experiments in population dynamics.

title: In Over Our Heads: Hibernation
description: I get tired just thinking about it, but it turns out that its not just bears that take pretty long naps.

title: In Over Our Heads: Tornadoes
description: Talking about the weather is a breeze when you're with a guy like Seth.

title: In Over Our Heads: Napalm
description: Napalm is among the nastiest of goos. The conversation gets a bit heated as we discuss international war treaties, otherworldly temperatures, and other bedtime stories.

title: In Over Our Heads: Eggs
description: I ducklare, I was in a pretty fowl mood when I realized how little I knew about these little life nuggets. One of my favorite episodes to date. All stunned reactions are real.

title: In Over Our Heads: Lightning
description: I was shocked that we knew as much as we did!

title: In Over Our Heads: Darwin's voyage to the Galapagos
In Over Our Heads: Other galaxies
description: I love space so much I won't even tarnish this episode with a tasteless pun.

title: In Over Our Heads: 3D printing
description: If you're into infinite numbers of everything then you're going to want to ink this one onto your to-do list.

title: In Over Our Heads: French Revolution
description: I don't want to (Ba)stille the show but history is not my strong suit and I kinda outperform Seth here. Kinda.

title: In Over Our Heads: Yetis
description: A pretty legendary performance for only the second episode. The best is yeti to come!

title: In Over Our Heads: Power steering
description: We're driving around in circles a bit but eventually cover some pretty interesting stuff. And by 'interesting' I mean completely speculative, and by 'stuff' I mean near-baseless assumptions.
